dlgLine.text: [START NORMAL] What is it, <charname>?

dlgAnsw.text: [Book] I have the Medical Dictionary you asked for.
[Upgrade] Is there anything you think would make things better around here?
[Luxury Need] Is there anything you'd like me to look for out in the field?
[Luxury Choc] I've got some fancy chocolates for you - will these do?
[Luxury Deodorant] I found you some deodorant.
[Questions] I had some questions for you.
Just seeing how you were doing. Bye for now.

dlgLine.text: [BASE NORMAL] Go on ahead.

dlgAnsw.text: [Book] I have the Medical Dictionary you asked for.
[Upgrade] Is there anything you think would make things better around here?
[Luxury Need] Is there anything you'd like me to look for out in the field?
[Luxury Choc] I've got some fancy chocolates for you - will these do?
[Luxury Deodorant] I found you some deodorant.
[Questions] I had some questions for you.
On second thought, let's talk later.

dlgLine.text: [UPGRADE] Honestly, in my opinion, that fence can't get sturdy enough. I've driven through enough of this state to know it's full of all kinds of quarries... if we could make some kind of stone fence, I'd sleep better at night. Even those monsters would fine it mighty hard to claw through rock.

dlgAnsw.text: [Base] I wanted to ask you something else...
Understood. I'll see what I can do.

dlgLine.text: [LUXURY NEED] My drinking days are past me, thank the Lord, but I still count chocolate as a vice - Alexander spoiled me something awful with some fancy truffles when he was alive, and since his passing, they've always brought up fond memories of him.

Aside from that, well... deodorant, if you can find it. When you're out on the road, you don't exactly get a lot of time to shower. I'd be embarrassed to tell you how much I counted on that stuff to make me feel like I could be seen in public during a long trip!

dlgAnsw.text: [Base] I wanted to ask you something else...
Understood. I'll see what I can find.

dlgLine.text: [LUXURY CHOC] These are lovely... thank you. It's a silly thing, I know, but it still means a lot to me.

dlgAnsw.text: [Base] I wanted to ask you something else...
Glad to help. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: [LUXURY DEODORANT] Oh, thank Heaven for this! I don't want to think of a time when we run out of deodorant. I once knew a woman who swore by some kind of natural method, but then, she sort of smelled... odd. I'm just so grateful to have this in the meantime!

dlgAnsw.text: [Base] I wanted to ask you something else...
Glad to help. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: [QUESTIONS NORMAL] I'll answer what I can...

dlgAnsw.text: [Background] Tell me about yourself.
[Skills] What would you say your skills are?
[Areas] What's it like in other areas out there?
Actually, it can wait. Bye.

dlgLine.text: [BACKGROUND] I'm a big rig driver - heavy transport. I took it up shortly after Renee's father died. I hated to leave her, but I needed to support the family... but you know how it goes.

I was on the road when I heard about how bad things were getting, and all I could think about was my daughter. I hightailed it to Baton Rouge to pick up Renee, and then we tried to make it back home to Taos.

You probably already guessed things didn't work out as planned. It's a good thing I've done runs through Texas multiple times, or we'd probably still be stuck near Dallas. We started getting on these windy back roads in an attempt to get through the state, but even that started to be trouble.

After a while, there just wasn't gas to be found anywhere, even in these tiny little towns. When that voice came on my radio letting us know about this place, it was like a sign from Heaven. <Anita sighs> We really owe Davis our lives - if it wasn't for him guiding us here, I don't even know if we'd be alive.

dlgAnsw.text: [Base] I wanted to ask you something else...
I understand. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: [SKILLS] Well, I'm not the sort of woman that brags, especially about things like this, but you don't drive a truck for as long as I have without knowing how to fight. Just have to when thieves come snooping around.
Aside from that, I know enough about fixing engines just enough to get them to start... but I couldn't rebuild one to save my life. Is that the sort of thing you needed to know?

dlgAnsw.text: [Base] I wanted to ask you something else...
Close enough. Let's talk later.

dlgLine.text: [AREAS] Do you know what I think? It's the end of the world. I pray to God it's not, but the signs are all there. The dead getting up and walking around? I can't quote scripture on it exactly, but I'm sure that's mentioned...

I've seen things in the last week that I never thought possible. It's downright hellish in some places with all the bodies, and fire, and gangs... For the first time ever, I'm glad Renee's father isn't alive, so he didn't have to go through this.

dlgAnsw.text: [Base] I wanted to ask you something else...
I understand. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: [BOOK] Oh, for Heaven's own sake - I don't believe it! If it's not exactly what I had in mind, it's close enough.
Bless you! I'll make sure she gets this. It'll help her - it'll help all of us! Thank you!

dlgAnsw.text: [Base] I wanted to ask you something else...
Glad to help. Hope she likes it.

dlgLine.text: [START FORGIVE] Yes?

dlgAnsw.text: [Upgrade] Can you think of anything you'd like to improve on or build around here?
[Luxury Need] Is there anything you'd like me to look for out in the field?
[Luxury Choc] I found some chocolates - I hope these are a type you like.
[Luxury Deodorant] Here's some deodorant, if you'd like it.
[Questions] I was wondering if I could ask you some questions.
Just seeing how you were doing. Bye for now.

dlgLine.text: [START HATE] What do you want?

dlgAnsw.text: [Upgrade Hate] Is there anything you think would make things better around here?
[Luxury Hate] Is there anything you'd like me to look for out in the field?
[Luxury Get Hate] I found you some deodorant.
[Questions Hate] I had some questions for you.
Just keeping an eye on you.

dlgLine.text: [BASE HATE] Fine.

dlgAnsw.text: [Upgrade Hate] Is there anything you think would make things better around here?
[Luxury Hate] Is there anything you'd like me to look for out in the field?
[Luxury Get Hate] I found you some deodorant.
[Questions Hate] I had some questions for you.
Never mind.

dlgLine.text: [QUESTIONS HATE] You're welcome to ask, but I can't say I'll always answer.

dlgAnsw.text: [Background Hate] Tell me about yourself.
[Skills Hate] What would you say your skills are?
Well, never mind then.

dlgLine.text: [UPGRADE HATE] A stronger fence. Something with stones... where I can sleep easier knowing those monsters can't get in.

dlgAnsw.text: [Base Hate] There was something else...
Understood. Goodbye.

dlgLine.text: [LUXURY HATE] There's not much you can do to make me happy with you, but... well. Deodorant would be a welcome thing.

dlgAnsw.text: [Base Hate] There was something else...
Understood. Goodbye.

dlgLine.text: [LUXURY GET HATE] That's... well. <She takes it from you slowly and nods.> I... thank you for thinking of me. I appreciate it.

dlgAnsw.text: [Base Hate] There was something else...
Glad to do so. Goodbye.

dlgLine.text: [BACKGROUND HATE] I used to drive a big rig. I tried to save my daughter, take her back home to Taos, but I got diverted and ended up here. And then I lost my Renee, and honestly, I spend my days now searching for God's reason why I'm still alive. Is that good enough for you?

dlgAnsw.text: [Base Hate] There was something else...
Er... sure. Bye.

dlgLine.text: [SKILLS HATE] I hate fighting, but I'm not bad with a sledgehammer. I can fix some mechanical things. And I work every day for the food we eat, in whatever way I can.

dlgAnsw.text: [Base Hate] There was something else...
Understood. Goodbye.

dlgLine.text: [START MOURN] Get away from me. I can't even look at you!

dlgAnsw.text: [Mourn Kind] I'm so sorry about Renee...
[Mourn Sharp] Renee's gone, but you can't mourn forever. We need to survive.
[Mourn Cruel] Yeah, your daughter's dead - but you think you're the only person who's lost someone? Get over yourself.

dlgLine.text: [MOURN KIND] You have no idea what you cost me. Renee was my little girl - she was all I had left! And you sent her out to die!

dlgAnsw.text: [Mourn Family] I lost my family in the plane crash, Anita - you don't think I know how much it hurts to lose someone?!
[Mourn Love] I lost someone I loved in the plane crash, Anita - you don't think I know how much it hurts?!
[Mourn Final] I wish I could bring her back, but at least - she died trying to keep us all alive. I'll never forget that.
[Mourn Close] I can't bring her back, Anita. The most we can do for her memory is stay alive.

dlgLine.text: [MOURN SHARP] It's easy for you to say! You have no idea what it was like for me to lose her - not to be able to do anything!

dlgAnsw.text: [Mourn Family] I lost my family in the plane crash, Anita - you don't think I know how much it hurts to lose someone?!
[Mourn Love] I lost someone I loved in the plane crash, Anita - you don't think I know how much it hurts?!
[Mourn Final] I wish I could bring her back, but at least - she died trying to keep us all alive. I'll never forget that.
[Mourn Close] I can't bring her back, Anita. The most we can do for her memory is stay alive.

dlgLine.text: [MOURN CRUEL] You're a hateful person. Do you know how hard my daughter worked to save your life? She hardly slept, and even when she tried, I know she woke up multiple times during then night to check on you. I believe God forgives, but you - I'll never forgive you!

dlgAnsw.text: <Anita turns away from you, trying to hide her tears.>

dlgLine.text: [MOURN FAMILY] I... <Anita chokes back a sob> I know it tears at you, but you... you know their deaths weren't your fault. I never... I never should have let you take her out there! I should have protected her with my life, as a parent should!

dlgAnsw.text: [Mourn Final] I wish I could bring her back, but at least - she died trying to keep us all alive. I'll never forget that.
[Mourn Close] I can't bring her back, Anita. The most we can do for her memory is stay alive.

dlgLine.text: [MOURN LOVE] I... <Anita chokes back a sob> At least you know their death wasn't your fault! I know how much it hurts to lose a partner, but a child... I never should have let you take her out there! I should have protected her with my life, as a parent should!

dlgAnsw.text: [Mourn Final] I wish I could bring her back, but at least - she died trying to keep us all alive. I'll never forget that.
[Mourn Close] I can't bring her back, Anita. The most we can do for her memory is stay alive.

dlgLine.text: [MOURN FINAL] <Anita sighs and wipes some tears from her eyes> I... I can't say that fixes anything, but... it does do my heart good to know you'll remember her. If you don't mind... I'd like some time to myself for a bit.

dlgAnsw.text: Of course.

dlgLine.text: [MOURN CLOSE] If you think that's the only proper way to appreciate the memory of someone who not only saved your life, but gave her own trying to protect this place... <Anita shakes her head angrily> I am finished with this conversation!

dlgAnsw.text: <Anita turns away from you, ending the conversation.>

dlgLine.text: I'll let Davis tell you about what's happening.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay.
Whatever.
